subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Arrow
entries: The Oath of the Arrow binds a paladin to the justice of the arrow making the usage of other weapons almost considered heresy. Following lofty ideals of justice they forsake their names and call themselves the valkyries after their founder, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good. They hold themselves to the highest standards of conduct and courage, even in the face of despair, believing that a heroic death in battle is the ultimate end to their service. The valkyries incorporate angelic wings onto their helmets and in their coat of arms as a homage to the angelic wings of the First Valkyrie.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Arrow
entries: The tenets of the Oath of the Arrow were written centuries ago by the founding archers of the order.

entries.name: Keep a steady aim
entries: Your aim must be true. Do not let your arm shiver when you face evil.

entries.name: Discipline and courage
entries: Be the paragon that lead the weak in the dark. Never falter and fight till the end.

entries.name: Just
entries: Always be true and just in your actions. Punish the guilty and right the wrong.

subclassFeature.name: Fightning Style
entries: When you swear the Oath of the Arrow at 3rd level you can replace a fighting style you know with another fighting style available to you. You also gain the option of chosing the following fighting styles.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Divine Smite
entries: When you swear the Oath of the Arrow at 3rd level you can use your divine smite feature on any weapon attack.
Your rigorous training has granted you the power to channel spells with your bow. Any spells that require a melee attack can now be used with a ranged weapon attack.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Open Sea Spells

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Arrow of the Guardian
entries: As an action, choose a point within 120 feet of you. As a special attack you shoot an arrow made of pure healing light at that point. Choose an amount of hit points equal to or less than your current Lay on Hands hit point pool.

You restore an amount of health equal to the value you exhausted from your Lay on Hands hit point pool, divided as you choose among any number of creatures within 15 feet of the chosen point. Each creature chosen also gains temporary hit points equal to your paladin level.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Piercing Light
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to imbue your bow with divine light. You don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead you create a holy beam of light that fires in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes radiant damage equal to your weapon damage plus an additional 1d8 radiant damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Cover
entries: Starting at 7th level, you constantly emanate an aura of cover while you're not {@condition incapacitated}. You and any creature of your choice within 10 feet of you gain the benefits of half cover against ranged attacks.
When you reach 18th level in this class, the range of the aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Blessed Shot
entries: You have learned to channel the divine through your bow. Starting at 15th level, you can now conjure your own arrows made out of light and no longer need ammunition to use your bow.
You ranged weapon damage rolls also gain a bonus equal to your {@ability cha} modifier.

subclassFeature.name: True Valkyrie
entries: At 20th level, you become one with the First Valkyrie. As a bonus action, you magically become the avatar of the Arrow, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Wings sprout from your back and grant you a flying speed of 60 feet.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as part of that action.
Your range weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
